text:
I am trying to solve a diophantine equation using a simple for loop to solve this equation:
`f(x,y) = x^2 + y^3 == 31`
So i have defined:
`X = collect(1:1:10)` e `Y= collect(1:1:10)`
and tried:
```for i in Y
    for j in X
          println(i, j, f(i,j))
    end
end```
There's a True return(2,3) and I want to get the X and Y of this True return and not all the false results…but I am not able to do it so far…any tips?
How can i code this?

elements.text: I am trying to solve a diophantine equation using a simple for loop to solve this equation:

for i in Y
    for j in X
          println(i, j, f(i,j))
    end
end

There's a True return(2,3) and I want to get the X and Y of this True return and not all the false results…but I am not able to do it so far…any tips?
How can i code this?

text:
```for i in Y, j in X
  f(i,j) != 31 && continue
  println("i = $i, j = $j, f(i,j) = $(f(i,j))")
end```

elements.text:
for i in Y, j in X
  f(i,j) != 31 && continue
  println("i = $i, j = $j, f(i,j) = $(f(i,j))")
end

text: i dont know why but its not returning anything

elements.text: i dont know why but its not returning anything

text:
```for i in Y, j in X
  !f(i,j) && continue
  println("i = $i, j = $j, f(i,j) = $(f(i,j))")
end```

elements.text:
for i in Y, j in X
  !f(i,j) && continue
  println("i = $i, j = $j, f(i,j) = $(f(i,j))")
end

text: It didn't work because Syx thought the function is returning the value of `x^2 + y^3`  but it is returning the boolean value of whether `x^2 + y^3` equal to 31. So just replace `f(i,j) != 31` with `!f(i,j)`

elements.text: It didn't work because Syx thought the function is returning the value of
but it is returning the boolean value of whether

text: If we believe Wikipedia, mathematicians are still searching for a solution for 114 <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sums_of_three_cubes>

elements.text: If we believe Wikipedia, mathematicians are still searching for a solution for 114

text: And the solution will likely involve numbers with, say 60 bits, rather than 10 bits, in which case your loops will have to run a bit longer :wink:
